RELIANCE.title: Reliance Q1 profit rises 15% on stronger energy margins
RELIANCE.text: Reliance Industries reported a 15% year-over-year rise in consolidated net profit to ₹21,342 crore for the June quarter while revenue grew 8%. Retail EBITDA expanded 24% and Jio added 9 million subscribers. Management reiterated capex guidance, debt-to-equity at 0.44 and positive free cash flow, signalling healthy balance-sheet momentum.

RELIANCE.title: Reliance retail arm posts record margins as festive demand kicks in
RELIANCE.text: Reliance Retail clocked all-time high quarterly revenue with same-store sales up 12% and digital commerce contributing 19% of turnover. Management guided for continued double-digit earnings growth aided by mix improvement and operating leverage.

CDSL.title: CDSL adds 1.2 million demat accounts in quarter, profit steady
CDSL.text: Central Depository Services added 1.2 million accounts during the quarter while net profit came in at ₹113 crore, broadly in line. Revenue rose 5% sequentially and annual earnings remain up 26%. Management highlighted debt-free balance sheet and strong cash to fund new technology projects.

CANBK.title: Canara Bank reports robust loan growth and lower slippages
CANBK.text: Canara Bank posted 18% year-on-year loan growth with retail credit expanding 24%. Net profit improved to ₹2350 crore as credit costs declined and the gross NPA ratio eased 32 bps sequentially. Management guided for NIMs above 3% and return on assets crossing 1% for FY26.

IOC.title: IOC posts marketing margin rebound; refining spreads hold
IOC.text: Indian Oil Corporation delivered ₹13,200 crore EBITDA with refining throughput of 18.1 MTPA. Marketing margins normalised as retail pricing hikes caught up with crude costs. Management expects capex of ₹22,000 crore focused on petrochemicals and green energy.

MARUTI.title: Maruti Suzuki wholesale volumes climb on SUV mix
MARUTI.text: Maruti Suzuki reported wholesale shipments of 198,000 units in July with SUVs forming 39% of the mix. Management noted demand resilience despite monsoon variability and reiterated margin guidance as commodity costs soften.

ACC.title: ACC cement dispatches rise 11%, pricing stays firm
ACC.text: ACC recorded 11% year-on-year volume growth aided by infrastructure demand while blended realizations improved 3%. Operating EBITDA per tonne crossed ₹950 with cost savings from alternative fuels. Management targets capacity of 45 MTPA by FY27.

HYUNDAI.title: Hyundai Motor India eyes 20% EV sales contribution by FY27
HYUNDAI.text: Hyundai Motor India plans to launch five new EV models by FY27 and is investing ₹35,000 crore in manufacturing and charging infrastructure. Export volumes remain resilient, supporting utilisation at the Chennai and upcoming Talegaon plants.
